result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas S. Zollicoffer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Instigation of Animal Fights [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 951.08(1).
  • Instigation of Animal Fights-Training [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 951.08(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution hearing to be held

***** 9-8-14 Judge Brash, Court orders restitution in the stipulated amount of $250.00 payable to the Milwaukee Domestic Animal Control Commission--to be paid first. The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means ****

Pay all mandatory applicable surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs. Pay all supervision fees. The Court ordered that all financial obligations be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
**8/16/2016  DNA surcharge on count two is vacated.
*9/18/2017  DNA surcharge vacated.
*9/19/2019   DNA surcharge vacated.  AMENDED Order Vacating DNA surcharge signed/filed.

Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program AFTER SERVING THE FIRST 3 YEARS OF THESE SENTENCES
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count two  and to any other time being served. Credit for 99 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain employment and work hours to the extent allowed by social security--if not receiving social security maintain full time employment or full time school with part time employment. 
Obtain GED or HSED.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

No drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers or drug houses). 
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Referrel to Mental Health division for mental assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment if necessary.
Take any medication prescribed only in the manner/dosage as prescribed by a treating physician.
Cooperate with random urine screens.
Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in Cognitive Thinking program.
Provide DNA sample--pay surcharge.
Obtain AODA assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment if appropriate.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one,  and to  any other time being served.

superMiscConds.notes: See Count 1 for Extended Supervision conditions

Attorney Gregg H. Novack in court, defendant Thomas S. Zollicoffer not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing Hearing this date.  Parties advised that the court is unable to hear this case on today due to calendar congestion.  New date selected with the parties.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Restitution request, received and filed.

Defendant Thomas S. Zollicoffer in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Thomas S. Zollicoffer in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Plea questionnaire and addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.  

Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements by the State.  Due to the lateness of the hour, Court ordered the sentencing hearing to be continued at a later date.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court retained file.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregg H Novack in court, defendant Thomas S. Zollicoffer not in court, in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court on State's Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial.  State argues motion.  Over the objection of defense, the Court grants motion.  Jury trial date of 7-14-14 at 9:00 a.m. vacated at this time.  Tentative plea hearing date of 7-07-14 at 1:30 p.m. remains.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Gregg H Novack in court, defendant Thomas S. Zollicoffer not in court, in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defense requests date for possible resolution to this matter prior to jury trial date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Final pre-trial scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.
